intro: Cremolobus benoistii, commonly known as the Benoist's milkweed, is a rare and specialized plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves adapted to store water, allowing it to survive in harsh, dry environments. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically yellow or greenish-yellow in color. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many milkweed species known for their toxic sap. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Cremolobus benoistii is considered a vulnerable species facing threats from habitat loss and climate change.
